channel.title: Blog on Aaron Jones
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Aaron Jones

item.title: Noobs-Term
item.description: Introduction Noobs Term is a terminal bundle that combines a few powerful programs with “sensible” configurations and a beautiful theme. I made Noobs Term to give people a foundation from which they can begin working with Zsh and Tmux without being overwhelmed with many customizations and options up front. When I first started using Zsh and Tmux, I found many configurations that offered some customization that I liked and some I either didn’t like or didn’t understand.

item.title: Vpn Server Select
item.description: This post explains how to set a VPN connection on a home router. I am using a Netgear R6300V2 with DD-WRT. For DD-WRT, you can check if your router is supported in the Router Database. Enable the CLI The CLI is disabled by default. It must be enabled to continue. Tested on DD-WRT version 24+ Load the DD-WRT WebUI (typically at http://192.168.1.1) Go to the Services tab Enable SSHd in the Secure Shell section Paste your public key (echo ~/id_rsa.
